data.description: Learn how to apply science to real life STEM contexts and develop your students' STEM skills. The outcomes of this professional development are: describe what good STEM provision in secondary school looks like; have a greater understanding of the range of careers options in STEM fields; develop ideas of how to use your knowledge of STEM careers in the classroom to support pupils to apply science learning in different contexts.
data.name: Developing STEM in the secondary curriculum

data.description: Outcomes: develop strategies for making the teaching of post-16 chemistry more engaging and inspiring; explore new creative approaches to practical work in post-16 chemistry; describe developments in some key areas of contemporary chemistry relevant to post-16 learners; consolidate their own knowledge about the appropriate management of risk; develop support networks for their own personal and professional development; share and exchange information about current national developments.
data.name: Chemistry summer school

badge_template_activities.title: This STEM Certificate was issued for attendance at professional development delivered by the STEM Learning Network in Scotland, for a total of 20.5 CPD hours

data.description: Develop the skills needed to deliver metalworking activities through professional demonstrations and practical tasks. The outcomes of this professional development are: work with a range of basic sheet metalwork hand tools; prepare and properly mark out sheet metal; to cut sheet metal using guillotine and notcher equipment; form sheet metal using benders and rollers in to various shapes; set up and perform spot welding operations safely; develop skills and knowledge of safe working practices.
data.name: Fabrication skills

badge_template_activities.title: This STEM Certificate was issued for attendance at professional development delivered by the STEM Learning Network in Scotland, for a total of 14 CPD hours

data.description: Develop skills in laser cutting, 3D printing, sublimation printing and vinyl cutting. The outcomes of this professional development are: develop skills in using laser cutters, 3D printers, sublimation printers and vinyl cutters; describe associated risks and hazards; demonstrate an understanding of the types of software used and how to set up equipment; develop skills and knowledge of calibrating and maintaining equipment; share and exchange information about current national developments.
data.name: Technology makerspace

badge_template_activities.title: This STEM Certificate was issued for attendance at professional development delivered by the STEM Learning Network in Scotland, for a total of 14 CPD hours

data.description: The outcomes of this professional development are: describe the risks and hazards associated with forging and using cold rolling equipment; correctly use appropriate PPE for Forging; demonstrate a range of forging techniques to produce metal-based artefacts; develop skills and knowledge of safe working practices; share and exchange information about current national developments; confidently and safely use cold rolling formers/benders.
data.name: Hot and cold metal forming
